sep=: Conduct informal meeting to explain topic

column5: The context indicates that writing a proposal depends on the chair's requirements, as some chairs require it while others do not. This suggests that the requirement to write and submit a proposal before accepting the thesis on Koinon is a business rule set by the chair, a stakeholder of the process.

The requirement for a proposal is up to each chair to decide, indicating that it is a business rule under the jurisdiction of the chair. The regular catch-up meetings are not mandated by the university but are a common practice among supervisors, suggesting that they are also a business rule.

column6: There is a logical dependency between the two activities. The proposal is a preliminary step that may or may not be required before the thesis can be registered and eventually submitted on Koinon. The submission of the thesis logically follows the proposal phase, as the proposal outlines the work that will be done in the thesis.

sep=: Get registered by chair on Koinon

The process seems to be under the jurisdiction of the university or the specific department, suggesting it is a business rule.
column6: There is a logical dependency as the registration on Koinon officially starts the timeline for the thesis, making it necessary to complete this step before starting the writing process.

sep=: Get registered by chair on Koinon

sep=: Get registered by chair on Koinon

column6: There is a data dependency between the two activities. The student cannot submit the thesis on Koinon without first being registered by the chair, as the registration provides necessary data and authorization for the submission process.

sep=: Get registered by chair on Koinon

This indicates that the order is a business rule set by the university or the chair, as it is part of the registration and approval process managed through the Koinon portal.
column6: There is a logical dependency between the two activities. The student cannot start writing the thesis without officially accepting it on Koinon, as this acceptance marks the official start of the thesis period.
